results.definition: structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted
examples: the highway was lined with signboards

results.definition: a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
examples: he showed signs of strain
they welcomed the signs of spring

results.definition: mark with one's signature; write one's name (on)
examples: She signed the letter and sent it off
Please sign here

results.definition: make the sign of the cross over someone in order to call on God for protection; consecrate
any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
examples: signals from the boat suddenly stopped

results.definition: engage by written agreement
examples: They signed two new pitchers for the next season

results.definition: used of the language of the deaf
an event that is experienced as indicating important things to come
examples: it was a sign from God

results.definition: approve and express assent, responsibility, or obligation
examples: Have you signed your contract yet?

results.definition: communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
examples: He signed his disapproval with a dismissive hand gesture
The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu

results.definition: (astrology) one of 12 equal areas into which the zodiac is divided
having an indicated pole (as the distinction between positive and negative electric charges)
examples: charges of opposite sign

results.definition: a character indicating a relation between quantities
examples: don't forget the minus sign

results.definition: a fundamental linguistic unit linking a signifier to that which is signified
examples: The bond between the signifier and the signified is arbitrary

results.definition: a gesture that is part of a sign language
a public display of a message
examples: he posted signs in all the shop windows

results.definition: be engaged by a written agreement
examples: He signed to play the casino on Dec. 18
The soprano signed to sing the new opera

results.definition: communicate in sign language
examples: I don't know how to sign, so I could not communicate with my deaf cousin

results.definition: (medicine) any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease
examples: there were no signs of asphyxiation

results.definition: place signs, as along a road
examples: sign an intersection
This road has been signed
